byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Antakya, and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAHER SAMAAN

abstract: Syrian government bombards rebel-held suburb of capital Damascus in air campaign that is said to have claimed at least 80 lives and wounded about 200; assault is among deadliest air attacks during more than four years of conflict in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The death toll in Douma, a rebel-held territory, puts the incident among the deadliest air attacks during more than four years of conflict in Syria.

headline.main: Government Airstrikes on Market in Syria Kill More Than 80
headline.print_headline: Airstrikes on Rebel-Held Area Kill Over 80 in Syria

snippet: The death toll in Douma, a rebel-held territory, puts the incident among the deadliest air attacks during more than four years of conflict in Syria.
